What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Acute promyelocytic leukaemia, t(15;17)(q22;q11-12)

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE 65 AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS MALE.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Sudden onset of easy bruising and bleeding gums
- Blood in your urine and noticeable petechiae on your skin
- Fatigue and weakness that has worsened over the past few days
- Shortness of breath and feeling faint at times
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION:
They started suddenly about three days ago, initially with just some minor gum bleeding and bruising, but then the bleeding became more prominent, and I noticed blood in my urine. I’ve been feeling more tired than usual, and yesterday I felt lightheaded when standing up. I’ve never experienced anything like this before, and I’m starting to get worried because it seems to be getting worse quickly.
output:
THINKING: I need to explain my situation clearly, mention how fast things are changing, and express some worry without sounding too prepared or expert. I should include my symptoms and how they started recently
ANSWER: Well, doctor, I’m 65 and I’m a guy. It all started a few days ago, I guess, with just some gum bleeding and easy bruising, but then it got worse—now I’m seeing blood when I pee and I got these little red spots on my skin, like petechiae. I’ve been feeling really tired and weak, and yesterday I sort of felt faint when I stood up. It all just came on pretty quickly, and I’m pretty worried because it seems to be getting worse fast. My family had some bleeding issues too, so I thought I better come in and get checked.
